required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dural Puncture Epidural Technique Versus Conventional Epidural Techmique
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Study Between Dural Puncture Epidural Technique Versus Conventional Epidural Technique During Laparoscopic Hysterectomy

brief_summary.textblock: This study will be conducted on 50 patients of ASA grade I and II aged from 25 to 55 years and presented for laparoscopic hysterectomy. Patients will be divided into two equal groups; group A control group for conventional epidural technique(n=25) and group B for 25G dural puncture epidural with 25G pencil point Whitacre spinal needle (n=25). Randomization will be done using computer generated number and concealed using sequentially numbered, sealed opaque envelope.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 minutes after local anesthetic injection
primary_outcome.description: Sensory blockade was evaluated using a non-traumatic pinprick stimulus starting at the S2 dermatome and moving in a caudad direction (measured every 2 minutes)

clinical_study.condition: Gynecologic Disease Requiring Laparoscopic Hysterectomy Under Neuraxial Anesthesia

arm_group.arm_group_label: Dural Puncture Epidural technique using pencil-point 25G Whitacre needle

intervention.description: Standard Lumbar Epidural Block using Touhy Epidural Needle (18G) at L2-3 inter-space and Epidural Catheter (20G) was inserted then bupivacaine 0.5% 15-20 ml with 50ug fentanyl was given.
intervention.arm_group_label: Dural Puncture Epidural technique using pencil-point 25G Whitacre needle

intervention.intervention_name: Dural Puncture Epidural Technique using pencil-point 25G Whitacre needle
intervention.description: 25G Dural Puncture Epidural Block at L2-3 inter-space then bupivacaine 0.5% 15-20 ml with 50ug fentanyl was given.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA I and II
- Height(150-170 cm)
Exclusion Criteria:
- patient refusal
- hypersensitivity to local anesthetic drugs
- bleeding disorders and coagulopathy(platelets count less than 80000,INR less than 1.5 or therapeutic dose of anticoagulant).

facility.name: Department of Anesthesia, Surgical ICU, and Pain Management
